content.text: The diagram shows the graphs with equations \(y = \operatorname {f}(x)\) and \(y = \operatorname {g}(x)\)

Describe fully a sequence of two transformations which transforms the graph of \(y = \operatorname {f}(x)\) to the graph of \(y = \operatorname {g}(x)\). Make clear the order in which the transformations should be applied.
Find the coordinates of the points of intersection of the curve and the line with equations
The coefficient of \(x^{7}\) in the expansion of \(\left(p x^{2} + \frac{4}{p} x\right)^{5}\) is 1280
Find the value of the constant \(p\)
Find the rate at which the \(y\)-coordinate of \(P\) is changing when \(x = 9\). Give your answer in terms of the constant \(a\)
Given that the curve has a minimum point when \(x = \frac{1}{4}\), find the value of \(a\)
A point \(P\) is moving along the curve with equation \(y = ax^{\frac{3}{2}} - 12x\) in such a way that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) is increasing at a constant rate of 5 units per second
State the greatest and least possible values of \(y\)
Sketch the curve
Hence determine the number of solutions of the equation \(4\cos 2x + 3 = 2x - 1\) for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant 2\pi\) .
The equation of a curve is \(y = 4\cos 2x + 3\) for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant 2\pi .\)

The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \frac{9}{\left(5x + 4\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}}\) and the line \(y = 6 - 3x\). The line and the curve intersect at the point \(P\) which has \(y\)-coordinate 3
Find the area of the shaded region
Prove the identity \(\frac{\tan \theta + 7}{\tan^2 \theta - 3} \equiv \frac{\sin \theta \cos \theta + 7 \cos^2 \theta}{1 - 4 \cos^2 \theta}\).
Hence solve the equation \(\frac{\sin \theta \cos \theta + 7 \cos^2 \theta}{1 - 4 \cos^2 \theta} = \frac{5}{\tan \theta}\) for \(0^\circ \leqslant \theta \leqslant 180^\circ\)
Find the coordinates of \(A, B\) and \(C\)
Find the angle \(ACB\) in radians. Give your answer correct to 3 significant figures
The chord \(AB\) divides the circle into two segments
Find the area of the larger segment

The diagram shows the circle with equation \(x^{2} + y^{2} - 14x + 8y + 36 = 0\) and the line \(y = -2\). The line intersects the circle at the points \(A\) and \(B\). The centre of the circle is \(C\)
Find an expression for \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\)
Find the \(x\)-coordinate of the other stationary point of the curve, and determine the nature of this stationary point.
Find the equation of the curve

Find the equation of the normal to the curve at the point where \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = -\frac{9}{4}\) and \(x\) is positive. Express your answer in the form \(px + qy + r = 0\) , where \(p\) , \(q\) and \(r\) are integers
The equation of a curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^2y}{\mathrm{dx}^2} = -\frac{24}{x^3}\). It is given that the curve has a stationary point at \((-2, 19)\)
Find the value of \(k\)
Find the sum of the first 20 terms of the progression
The first, second and third terms of an arithmetic progression are \(4k, k^2\) and \(8k\) respectively, where \(k\) is a non-zero constant
The fourth and sixth terms of a geometric progression are 36 and 6 respectively. The common ratio of the progression is positive
Find the sum to infinity of the progression. Give your answer in the form \(\frac{a}{\sqrt{b} - c}\) , where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers
Express \(x^{2} + 4x + 2\) in the form \((x + a)^{2} + b\) , where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\)
Find an expression for \((\mathrm{gf})^{-1}(x)\)
The functions f and g are defined as follows
